alert.note: Alert for Adams; Buffalo; Hall; Kearney; Webster (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Hastings (North Central Kansas and South Central Nebraska)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 24 at 11:55PM CDT by NWS Hastings
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northeastern Franklin, northwestern Webster, Adams, Kearney, southeastern Buffalo and southwestern Hall Counties through 1230 AM CDT... At 1155 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from Kearney to Minden to 6 miles southwest of Upland. Movement was east at 50 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Upland around 1200 AM CDT. Heartwell and Norman around 1205 AM CDT. Campbell around 1210 AM CDT. Gibbon and Holstein around 1215 AM CDT. Shelton, Bladen and Roseland around 1220 AM CDT. Kenesaw around 1225 AM CDT. Blue Hill, Juniata, Ayr and Prosser around 1230 AM CDT. This includes Interstate 80 between mile markers 269 and 302. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. These storms may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.
